abstract: The parties to the Google book settlement, which would legalize the creation of a vast library of digital books, have asked the judge overseeing a revision of the agreement for an extension.
snippet: The parties to the Google book settlement, which would legalize the creation of a vast library of digital books, have asked the judge overseeing a revision of the agreement for an extension.
lead_paragraph: The parties to the Google book settlement, which would legalize the creation of a vast library of digital books, have asked the judge overseeing a revision of the agreement for an extension to this Friday, Nov. 13.

headline.main: In Google Book Case, a Request for More Time

abstract: The parties to the proposed legal settlement over Google’s plan to digitize the world’s books have asked the judge for more time to craft a deal.
snippet: The parties to the proposed legal settlement over Google’s plan to digitize the world’s books have asked the judge for more time to craft a deal.
lead_paragraph: From our colleagues at Media Decoder:

headline.main: Parties Seek More Time to Craft Google Books Deal

abstract: The acquisition will help the Internet search company to speed up efforts to develop more effective tools for creating and placing mobile ads on smartphones and other devices.
snippet: The acquisition will help the Internet search company to speed up efforts to develop more effective tools for creating and placing mobile ads on smartphones and other devices.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  In a push to expand its digital advertising empire to cellphones, Google has agreed to acquire AdMob, a fast-growing mobile advertising start-up, for $750 million in stock, the companies said Monday.

headline.main: Google Set to Acquire AdMob for $750 Million
headline.print_headline: Google Set to Acquire AdMob for $750 Million

abstract: Google is acquiring mobile advertising company AdMob for $750 million, furthering the company’s push into the fast-growing market of Web-enabled cell phones.
snippet: Google is acquiring mobile advertising company AdMob for $750 million, furthering the company’s push into the fast-growing market of Web-enabled cell phones.
lead_paragraph: Update | 2:05 p.m. Google has agreed to buy AdMob, a fast-growing start-up that developed technology to place ads on mobile phones, for $750 million in stock, the company said Monday, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft reported from San Francisco.

headline.main: Google Strikes $750 Million Stock Deal for AdMob

abstract: A new deadline of Nov. 13 in the Google settlement case.
snippet: A new deadline of Nov. 13 in the Google settlement case.
lead_paragraph: After the parties to the Google settlement requested an extension on the deadline to submit a revised agreement that would address the concerns of the Justice Department and others, Judge Denny Chin agreed to set a new deadline of Friday, Nov. 13.

headline.main: Update: Judge Grants Extension in Google Case
